greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let S_n denote the list of decimal numbers 0 to n, written backwards (allowing leading zeros) and arranged in lexicographic order; a(n) = position where backwards-n appears, starting indexing at 0.
link: Chai Wah Wu and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000 (first 10000 terms from Chai Wah Wu)
formula: a(0) = 0, a(10n+m) = a(n) + m*(n+1) for m in {0,...,9}. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 20 2015
program: return sorted(str(i)[::-1] for i in range(n+1)).index(str(n)[::-1]) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Nov 20 2015
xref: Has same beginning as A061486 but is ultimately different: see A264668.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 20 2015
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 20 2015
